traits.text: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 1,5 m of it must make a CD 14 Constitution tiro salvezza. On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Tentacle.
actions.text: Attacco con Arma da Mischia: +9 a colpire, portata 3 m., un bersaglio. Colpito: 12 (2d6 + 5) contundenti danni. If the bersaglio is a creature, it must succeed on a CD 14 Constitution tiro salvezza or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature’s skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can’t regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease--curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) da acido danni every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

actions.name: Enslave (3/Day).
actions.text: The aboleth bersagli one creature it can see within 9 m of it. The bersaglio must succeed on a CD 14 Wisdom tiro salvezza or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the bersaglio. The charmed bersaglio is under the aboleth’s control and can’t take reactions, and the aboleth and the bersaglio can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance. Whenever the charmed bersaglio takes danni, the bersaglio can repeat the tiro salvezza. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the bersaglio can also repeat the tiro salvezza when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth. The aboleth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The aboleth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

actions.name: Detect.

Colpito:8 (1d6 + 5) perforanti danni, and the bersaglio must succeed on a CD 13 Constitution tiro salvezza or be avvelenato for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the bersaglio is unconscious. Another creature can use an action to shake the bersaglio awake.

actions.name: Constrict.
actions.text: Attacco con Arma da Mischia:+6 a colpire, portata 3 m., one Medium or smaller creature. Colpito:10 (2d6 + 3) contundenti danni, and the bersaglio is afferrato (escape CD 15). Until this grapple ends, the bersaglio is trattenuto, and the couatl can’t constrict another bersaglio.

actions.name: Change Shape.
actions.text: The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl’s choice). In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

traits.name: Echolocation.
traits.text: The darkmantle can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

traits.name: False Appearance.
traits.text: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

traits.name: Skills
traits.text: Stealth +3

actions.name: Crush.
actions.text: Attacco con Arma da Mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1,5 m., one creature. Colpito: 6 (1d6 + 3) contundenti danni, and the darkmantle attaches to the bersaglio. If the bersaglio is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has vantaggio on the tiro per colpire, it attaches by engulfing the bersaglio’s head, and the bersaglio is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.  While attached to the bersaglio, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the bersaglio but has vantaggio on its attack rolls. The darkmantle’s speed also becomes 0, it can’t benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the bersaglio.  A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful CD 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the bersaglio by using 1,5 m of movement.

actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day).
actions.text: A 15--foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

traits.name: Death Throes.
traits.text: When the balor dies, it explodes, and each creature within 9 m of it must make a CD 20 Dexterity tiro salvezza, taking 70 (20d6) da fuoco danni on a failed save, or half as much danni on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren’t being worn or carried, and it destroys the balor’s weapons.

traits.name: da fuoco Aura.
traits.text: At the start of each of the balor’s turns, each creature within 1,5 m of it takes 10 (3d6) da fuoco danni, and flammable objects in the aura that aren’t being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balor or hits it with a melee attack while within 1,5 m of it takes 10 (3d6) da fuoco danni.

traits.name: Magic Resistance.
traits.text: The balor has vantaggio on tiro salvezzas against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Wall of Ice (Recharge 6).
actions.text: The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 18 m of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 9 m long and 3 m high, or it’s a hemispherical dome up to 6 m in diameter.  When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a CD 17 Dexterity tiro salvezza, taking 35 (10d6) da freddo danni on a failed save, or half as much danni on a successful one. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10--foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to da fuoco danni, and immunity to da acido, da freddo, necrotici, poison, and psichici danni. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a CD 17 Constitution tiro salvezza, taking 17 (5d6) da freddo danni on a failed save, or half as much danni on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.

traits.name: Shapechanger.
traits.text: The imp can use its action to polymorph into a beast form that resembles a rat (speed 6 m.), a raven (6 m., fly 18 m.), or a spider (6 m., climb 6 m.), or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Invisibility.

actions.name: Frightful Presence.
actions.text: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 36 m of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a CD 19 Wisdom tiro salvezza or become spaventato for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s tiro salvezza is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5-6).
actions.text: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 90--foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a CD 22 Constitution tiro salvezza, taking 77 (22d6) poison danni on a failed save, or half as much danni on a successful one. The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

actions.name: Detect.
actions.text: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

actions.name: Tail Attack.
actions.text: The dragon makes a tail attack.

actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions).
actions.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 4,5 m of the dragon must succeed on a CD 23 Dexterity tiro salvezza or take 15 (2d6 + 8) contundenti danni and be knocked prono. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

senses_text: blindsight 60 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 22

traits.name: Amphibious.
traits.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
traits.text: If the dragon fails a tiro salvezza, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.text: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice).  In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form. actions.name: Fey Charm.
actions.text: The dryad bersagli one humanoid or beast that she can see within 9 m of her. If the bersaglio can see the dryad, it must succeed on a CD 14 Wisdom tiro salvezza or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the bersaglio isn’t under the dryad’s control, it takes the dryad’s requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.  Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the bersaglio, it can repeat the tiro salvezza, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the bersaglio, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a bersaglio’s tiro salvezza is successful, the bersaglio is immune to the dryad’s Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.  The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

actions.text: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

actions.name: Horrifying Visage.
actions.text: Each non--undead creature within 18 m of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a CD 13 Wisdom tiro salvezza or be spaventato for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the bersaglio also ages 1d4 × 10 years. A spaventato bersaglio can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the spaventato condition on itself on a success. If a bersaglio’s tiro salvezza is successful or the effect ends for it, the bersaglio is immune to this ghost’s Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restorationspell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

actions.name: Possession (Recharge 6).
actions.text: One humanoid that the ghost can see within 1,5 m of it must succeed on a CD 13 Charisma tiro salvezza or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the bersaglio is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn’t deprive the bersaglio of awareness. The ghost can’t be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and spaventato. It otherwise uses the possessed bersaglio’s statistics, but doesn’t gain access to the bersaglio’s knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 1,5 m of the body. The bersaglio is immune to this ghost’s Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the tiro salvezza or after the possession ends.

If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points. The golem’s creator, if within 18 m of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a CD 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes danni while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

If this effect reduces the bersaglio’s hit point maximum to 0, the bersaglio dies, and if the bersaglio was evil, its soul is trapped in the hag’s soul bag. traits.text: When a creature that can see the medusa’s eyes starts its turn within 9 m of the medusa, the medusa can da forza it to make a CD 14 Constitution tiro salvezza if the medusa isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. If the tiro salvezza fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is trattenuto. The trattenuto creature must repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restorationspell or other magic.  Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the tiro salvezza at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can’t see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 9 m of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

actions.name: Frightful Presence.
actions.text: Each creature of the tarrasque’s choice within 36 m of it and aware of it must succeed on a CD 17 Wisdom tiro salvezza or become spaventato for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, with svantaggio if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s tiro salvezza is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Swallow.
actions.text: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the bersaglio takes the bite’s danni, the bersaglio is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and trattenuto, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 (16d6) da acido danni at the start of each of the tarrasque’s turns. If the tarrasque takes 60 danni or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a CD 20 Constitution tiro salvezza at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prono in a space within 3 m of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer trattenuto by it and can escape from the corpse by using 9 m of movement, exiting prono. The tarrasque can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The tarrasque regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

actions.name: Attack.

An animated tree acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 36 m from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

traits.name: Shapechanger.
traits.text: If the vampire isn’t in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form. While in bat form, the vampire can’t speak, its walking speed is 1,5 m, and it has a flying speed of 9 m. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies. While in mist form, the vampire can’t take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 6 m, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can’t pass through water. It has vantaggio on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution tiro salvezzas, and it is immune to all nonmagical danni, except the danni it takes from sunlight.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day).
traits.text: If the vampire fails a tiro salvezza, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Misty Escape.
traits.text: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling unconscious, provided that it isn’t in sunlight or running water. If it can’t transform, it is destroyed.  While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can’t revert to its vampire form, and it must portata its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

traits.name: Regeneration.
traits.text: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn’t in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radianti danni or danni from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the vampire’s next turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb.
traits.text: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses.
traits.text: The vampire has the following flaws: Forbiddance. The vampire can’t enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes 20 da acido danni if it ends its turn in running water. Stake to the Heart. If a perforanti weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire’s heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed. Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radianti danni when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has svantaggio on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only).

Colpito:7 (1d6 + 4) perforanti danni plus 10 (3d6) necrotici danni. The bersaglio’s hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotici danni taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the bersaglio finishes a long rest. The bersaglio dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire’s control.

traits.name: Charm.
traits.text: The vampire bersagli one humanoid it can see within 9 m of it. If the bersaglio can see the vampire, the bersaglio must succeed on a CD 17 Wisdom tiro salvezza against this magic or be charmed by the vampire. The charmed bersaglio regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the bersaglio isn’t under the vampire’s control, it takes the vampire’s requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing bersaglio for the vampire’s bite attack. Each time the vampire or the vampire’s companions do anything harmful to the bersaglio, it can repeat the tiro salvezza, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the bersaglio, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action. The vampire can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The vampire regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
